net.sf.mmm.util.version.api

Interface VersionUtil

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    VersionUtilImpl

    @ComponentSpecification
public interface VersionUtil
    This is the interface for a collection of utility functions that help to deal with versions. E.g. you can parse a a version String to a VersionIdentifier.
    Since:
    3.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String CDI_NAME
      The CDI name.

    • Method Detail

      • createVersionIdentifier

        VersionIdentifier createVersionIdentifier(String versionString)
                                   throws NlsParseException
        This method parses the given versionString and builds an according VersionIdentifier instance. It delegates to createFormatter(String, boolean) using false for normalizeFormat.
        Parameters:
        versionString - is the string representation of a VersionIdentifier.
        Returns:
        the parsed VersionIdentifier.
        Throws:
        NlsParseException - if the given versionString is invalid and could not be parsed.

      • createVersionIdentifier

        VersionIdentifier createVersionIdentifier(String versionString,
                                          boolean normalizeFormat)
                                   throws NlsParseException
        This method parses the given versionString and builds an according VersionIdentifier instance.
        Parameters:
        versionString - is the string representation of a VersionIdentifier.
        normalizeFormat - - if true the returned VersionIdentifier will return a normalized string representation that may differ from the given versionString. Otherwise the original versionString will be used.
        Returns:
        the parsed VersionIdentifier.
        Throws:
        NlsParseException - if the given versionString is invalid and could not be parsed.

      • getDefaultFormatter

        VersionIdentifierFormatter getDefaultFormatter()
        Returns:
        the default VersionIdentifierFormatter.
        Since:
        6.0.0

        VersionIdentifierFormatter createFormatter(String formatPattern)
        Variant of createFormatter(String, boolean) with strict mode.
        Parameters:
        formatPattern - is the format string.
        Returns:
        the according VersionIdentifierFormatter.
        See Also:
        createFormatter(String, boolean)

      • createFormatter

        VersionIdentifierFormatter createFormatter(String formatPattern,
                                           boolean strict)
        This method creates a VersionIdentifierFormatter for the given formatPattern. Similar to SimpleDateFormat the format pattern is parsed and there are particular letter symbols that have a specific meaning.
        letter meaning comment
        V version segments Needs to be of the form V<separator>[{<min>,<max>,<padding>}] where <separator> is a character used to separate the version segments (typically the dot sign '.'). Further, <min> and <max> are the minimum and maximum number of segments to format and <padding> is the minimum number of digits to pad each segment.
        P phase The official phase name - typically you want to use "A" instead. May be followed by {<max>} to limit (truncate) to a maximum number of characters.
        A alias The phase alias. May be followed by {<max>} to limit (truncate) to a maximum number of characters.
        N phase number The phase number. May be followed by {<padding>} to pad to a minimum number of digits.
        S snapshot indicator The snapshot indicator. May be followed by {<indicator>} to override the default snapshot indicator with {<indicator>}.
        L label The label. May be followed by {<max>} to limit (truncate) to a maximum number of characters.
        R revision The revision. May be followed by {<padding>} to pad to a minimum number of digits.
        T timestamp The timestamp by default in basic ISO-8601 format. May be followed by {<format>} to use the given format instead as SimpleDateFormat pattern (e.g. "T{yyyy-MM-dd}").
        As all ASCII letters are reserved for existing letter symbol definitions (see table above) or further extensions, you need to enclose static text in braces (e.g. "(rev)" to represent the static String "rev" as infix for a format pattern).
        Further, infix text (no matter if enclosed in braces or not) is omitted if the following letter symbol is resolved as undefined. To prevent this add the dollar character ($) to terminate a static infix that should always occur.
        segment count major minor milli micro phase alias phase number snapshot label revision timestamp formatPattern format
        4 1 2 3 4 null null null false null null null "V.-AN-S-L-(rev)R-T" "1.2.3.4-GA"
        4 1 2 3 4 "update" "SR" 2 false null 654321 null "V.-AN-S-L-(rev)R-T" "1.2.3.4-SR2-rev654321"
        4 1 2 3 4 "update" "SR" 2 true kassiopeia 654321 31.12.1999 23:59:59 UTC "V.-AN-S-L-(rev)R-T" "1.2.3.4-SR2-SNAPSHOT-kassiopeia-rev654321-19991231T23:59:59Z"
        4 1 2 3 4 "update" "SR" 2 true null 654321 31.12.1999 23:59:59 UTC "V.{0,3,2}P{2}N{2}-S{snap}_$-L-(rev)R-T" "01.02.03up02-snap_-rev654321-19991231T23:59:59Z"
        Parameters:
        formatPattern - is the format string.
        strict - - if true then the given formatPattern has to include at least the version segments, the phase (in any form including alias), phase number, and snapshot.
        Returns:
        the according VersionIdentifierFormatter.
